Articles.Content:
It happens all the time but now that my missions are more involved its really a problem.

I quick save..

time passes (maybe 30 mins of game play?)

something bad happens.

I reload

I am exactly the same place I was when the bad thing happened.

I am saving with F5. Then for reload I go out of game to main menu and re-enter.

what am I doing wrong?

Edited June 3, 2014 by Tux
ANSWERED

When something bad happens hold down the F9 key and it will reload the game as of when you quicksaved with the F5 key. It is a good plan to F5 just before you think something may go wrong, such as when you are in orbit and are about to start a landing attempt.
The game autosaves fairly regularly , this us what us being reloaded when you exit to the main menu and reenter. However this is completely different from a quicksave.

It happens all the time but now that my missions are more involved its really a problem.

I quick save..

time passes (maybe 30 mins of game play?)

something bad happens.

I reload

I am exactly the same place I was when the bad thing happened.

I am saving with F5. Then for reload I go out of game to main menu and re-enter.

what am I doing wrong?

If you leave the game and reenter, the game makes an autosave (when you leave), and loads that autosave (when you re enter).

To load a quicksave, hold F9
